Highly motivated, emerging professional with strong education in laboratory science; well prepared
to excel in a medical laboratory; MLS(ASCP)
CM
certification. Related skills and experience include:
Laboratory Testing: Proficiency in a range of procedures including automated and manual
testing for microbiology, hematology, urinalysis, and immunohematology. Expertise in correct
specimen handling processes.
Operations & Organization: Proven ability to contribute effectively to productive operations
and support quality patient care, collaborating with medical teams at all levels. Adept at
accurately managing data entry and maintaining detailed records.
Technical Skills: Experience operating, maintaining, and calibrating Vitek 2, Immucor Galileo
Echo, Abbot Architect, Beckman Coulter LH 780 and DL 2000, Diagnostica Stago Compact,
and Iris, as well as direct success utilizing Meditech software.
Achievements / Strengths: Demonstrated commitment to delivering high-quality
performance and exceeding expectations, with talent for quickly excelling in new
responsibilities. Strong problem-solving skills; adept at identifying and resolving issues.

ST. MARY’S REGIONAL HOSPITAL, Grand Junction, CO
Student Intern, 7/2011 to 11/2011
Effectively applied education to assist in operations, collaborating with Technicians and
healthcare teams to support patient care needs. Conducted automated and manual tests,
including hematology, microbiology, chemistry, coagulation, urinalysis, and immunohematology;
entered test results into system. Ensured compliance with department procedures for specimen
processing and handling throughout all stages of testing. Identified potential specimen issues
relating to result discrepancies. Communicated with Physicians and Nurses on test results and
specimen issues.
Successfully identified operational issues, including units of blood stored on wrong shelf
and typos on patient armbands.
Consistently recognized by supervisors for motivation and high-quality performance.
SECURITY FORCES, INC. — Atlanta, GA
Security Officer, 5/2007 to 7/2011
Conducted foot and vehicular patrols at commercial and industrial sites. Identified and addressed
potential security concerns and incidents. Communicated with client management and law
enforcement agencies. Provided concierge service for visitors. Compiled data and prepared
reports on patrols and incidents.
Identified and reported potential DUI case to law enforcement, as well as providing
testimony in court.
Consistently praised for high performance, including willingness to cover additional shifts.
